Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Torso of a Person Wearing a Greek Tunic
Description: The torso of a person wearing a Greek tunic, called a "chiton". The tunic has folds with arranged horizontal lines; it covers the shoulder and the right side of the body. The left hand is resting on the abdomen, and gives the impression that he is gripping the edge of his garment with it; the right arm is along the right side. The fist is gripping a fragment of a broken object, which is not recognizable. The statue illustrates the beauty and harmony of the body, which were the characteristics of the Hellenistic sculpture of that era
